title: Nuclear and Related Techniques for Climate Action in Food and Agriculture

tasks.task: Conducting research on agri-food systems using nuclear techniques to address climate change.
subtasks: Analyzing soil, water, and nutrients in cropping systems using isotope and nuclear techniques.
Developing crop varieties resistant to harsh conditions via irradiation-induced mutations.
Implementing the Sterile Insect Technique (SIT) to manage insect pests sustainably.
Enhancing livestock production and health through optimized feed, genetic improvements, and disease management.
Ensuring food safety by detecting harmful residues and contaminants using analytical techniques.

tasks.task: Promoting sustainable agricultural practices and reducing environmental impact.
subtasks: Optimizing crop water efficiency and fertilizer usage.
Combating land degradation and increasing crop resilience to climate change.
Managing greenhouse gas emissions in animal agriculture.

tasks.task: Safeguarding public health and market access through food-derived technologies.
subtasks: Detecting foodborne illnesses and invasive pests.
Addressing food fraud and ensuring market access.
